info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 7 at 8:46AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Sabine River Near Gladewater affecting Gregg, Upshur and Smith Counties.
For the Sabine River...including Gladewater...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sabine River near Gladewater.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding to continue with oil field operations curtailed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday afternoon and continue rising to 28.8 feet Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 900 AM CDT.
